sen.j: 徳大寺 公純（とくだいじ きんいと、文政4年11月28日 (旧暦)（1821年12月22日）- 明治16年（1883年）11月5日）は、幕末期の公卿（大納言後に内大臣・右大臣）。
sen.e: Kinito TOKUDAIJI (December 22, 1821-November 5, 1883) was Kugyo (the top court officials) in the end of the Edo period (Dainagon [Major Counselor] and later Naidaijin [minister of the center] and Udaijin [minister of the right]).

sen.j: 従一位｡鷹司政通の子。
sen.e: His official court rank was Juichii (Junior First Rank) and he was a son of Masamichi TAKATSUKASA.
His official court rank was Juichii (Junior First Rank) and he was a son of Masamichi TAKATSUKASA.

sen.j: 母は徳川治紀の娘・鄰姫。
sen.e: His mother was Rinhime, a daughter of Harutoshi TOKUGAWA.
His mother was Rinhime, a daughter of Harutoshi TOKUGAWA.

sen.j: 徳大寺実堅の養子。
sen.e: He was an adopted son of Sanemi TOKUDAIJI.

sen.j: 子には徳大寺実則（宮内大臣）、西園寺公望（第12・14代内閣総理大臣）、末弘威麿（財団法人立命館理事）、住友友純（15代住友吉左衛門）、中院通規、福子（加藤泰秋室）、永（相良頼基室）、中子（相良頼紹室）、照子（阿部正功室）らがいる。
sen.e: His children were Sanetsune TOKUDAIJI (Imperial Household Minister), Kinmochi SAIONJI (the 12th and 14th prime minister), Takemaro SUEHIRO (director of Ritsumeikan Foundation), Tomoito SUMITOMO (the 15th Kichizaemon SUMITOMO), Michinori NAKANOIN (中院通規), Fukuko (福子)(a wife of Yasuaki KATO), Ei (a wife of Yoritomo SAGARA), Nakako (中子)(a wife of Yoritsugu SAGARA [相良頼紹]), Teruko (a wife of Masakoto ABE) and so on.
sen.cmt: 中院通規、福子、中子、相良頼紹の読み方不明です。

sen.j: なお、公純はなぜか生前には正式な婚姻を行わなかったために、これらの子供達はいずれも庶子扱いとされている。
sen.e: In addition, since Kinito did not marry formerly through his life, the reason of which is not clear, these children were all treated as children born out of wedlock.
In addition, since Kinito did not marry formally through his life, the reason of which is not clear, these children were all treated as children born out of wedlock.
sen.cmt: スペルミス訂正しました。
sen.e: In addition, since Kinito did not marry formally through his life, the reason of which is not clear, these children were all treated as children born out of wedlock.

sen.j: 幼名は祐君。
sen.e: His childhood name was Yukun (祐君).
sen.cmt: 祐君の読み方不明です。

sen.j: 1850年、大納言となる。
sen.e: In 1850 he was assigned to Dainagon.

sen.j: 1857年に議奏となった。
sen.e: In 1857 he was assigned to giso (a position conveying what the congress decides to the emperor).

sen.j: 1858年、日米修好通商条約が起こると、条約勅許に反対したため、井伊直弼による安政の大獄で「悪謀企策の者」として逮捕され、謹慎50日間を命じられた。
sen.e: When Treaty of amity and commerce between the United states and Japan was concluded in 1858, he was arrested as 'a person who plotted' in Ansei no Taigoku (suppression of extremists by the Shogunate) by Naosuke II because he was against the Imperial sanction for the treaty and punished with house arrest of 50 days.
sen.cmt: 「日米修好通商条約が起こると」は「日米修好通商条約が締結されると」と解釈して訳しました。

sen.j: しかし1ヶ月間で罪を許されている。
sen.e: However, he was forgiven one month later.

sen.j: その後は公武合体運動を推進して二条斉敬らと共に活躍した。
sen.e: After that, he promoted Kobu Gattai (Union of Court and Camp) movement and was flourished with Nariyuki NIJO and others.

sen.j: が、和宮親子内親王の徳川家茂降嫁に関しては反対の立場を取ったため、幕府から圧力を受けて失脚している。
sen.e: However, since he was against the marriage of the Imperial Princess Kazunomiya Chikako with Iemochi TOKUGAWA, he was overthrown under pressure from bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: その後、復帰して執政となった。
sen.e: Later, he returned to the Imperial Court and was assigned to administration.

sen.j: こうした政治的変動の中で公純も命を狙われており、1863年には家臣・滋賀右馬允が公武合体に反対する浪士達に殺害されている。
sen.e: In such political change, Kinito was also plotted to assassinate and his retainer Umanojo SHIGA (滋賀右馬允) was killed by roshi (masterless samurai) who were against Kobu Gattai in 1863.

sen.j: 明治以後も攘夷論公家としての矜持を保ち、京都に留まった。
sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration, he had kept kyoji (pride) as kuge (court noble) of the principle of excluding foreigners and stayed in Kyoto.

sen.j: たとえ身内の者であっても洋装の客に対しては決して会おうとはしなかった。
sen.e: He never meet a guest who put on Western clothes even if he was his relative.
